title: Managing Connections
text: can define database connections config files read processed connect() function. example, config file called my_db_config.yml, might run:
code: library(sqlhelper)  connect("my_db_config.yml")

title: Managing Connections
text: config file can contain one connection definitions. Connection definitions YAML. following YAML chunk defines connection called ‘dap’. first line name connection; subsequent lines contain information connection. driver_type line defines flavour database, hence driver package used. parameter required. Current options : ‘sqlserver’ (odbc) ‘sqlite’ (RSQLite) ‘postgresql’ (RPostgres) ‘mysql/mariadb’(RMariaDB) ‘bigquery’ (bigquery) pool line determines whether single connection required (returned DBI::dbConnect()) pool connections (returned pool::dbPool()). latter recommended shiny applications. parameter defaults ‘’, meaning single connection provided. description line provides short description connection. parameter can omitted. connection section contains several lines provide parameters required connection , passed constructor function name=value pairs. example, need supply Driver connection string using odbc driver. server parameter probably always required see DBI::dbConnect() details. summary, elements needed every connection : connection name, driver_type, connection section containing Server element others may needed connections may omitted entirely. function config_examples() provides several example configurations.
code: dap:   driver_type: sqlserver   pool: yes   description: >     Databases managed by ADD teams on the Data and Analytics Platform   connection:     Driver: "{ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server}"     Server: "Dap-sql01"     Trusted_Connection: "yes"

title: Managing Connections
text: default, connect() function reads config file named config_filename parameter, also config files found search path includes user’s site’s config directories. use database connections often, can place config file called sqlhelper_db_config.yml directory named rappdirs::user_config_dir(). Similarly, site admin can provide users pre-configured connections placing config file name directory named rappdirs::site_config_dir(). either cases, config filename needed connect() can called without arguments. Nonetheless, case require additional connections provided user- site-wide configurations, may provide config_filename argument.

what: File precedence and conflicts across config files
title: Managing Connections
text: Site-wide config files read first, user-wide, named files. conflicting connection names connection elements encountered config files, values later files overwrite earlier. operates element--element basis; example, site-wide config contains: named file contains: sqlhelper attempt create connection described :
code: my_conn:   server_type: mysql   connection:     Server: "organization_server_host" my_conn:   description: Private MySQL database   connection:     Server: "my_alternate_server_host" my_conn:   server_type: mysql   description: Private MySQL database   connection:     Server: "my_alternate_server_host"

title: Managing Connections
text: one config file wanted, config search path may suppressed supplying exclusive = TRUE argument. exclusive = TRUE, connect() check whether config_filename one ‘user’ ‘site’. , user- site-wide config file sought; ‘user’ ‘site’, treated name config file.

title: Managing Connections
text: connect() called, may inspect created connections connection_info().
code: library(sqlhelper)  readLines("resources/sqlhelper_db_conf.yml") |>   writeLines() #> simple_sqlite: #>   driver_type: sqlite #>   description: "A simple connection to an in-memory database" #>   connection: #>     Server: ":memory:" #>  #>  #> pool_sqlite: #>   driver_type: sqlite #>   pool: yes #>   description: "A pooled connection to an in-memory database" #>   connection: #>     Server: ":memory:"  connect("resources/sqlhelper_db_conf.yml", exclusive = TRUE)  connection_info() #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   name          description                   live  default driver conn_…¹ pool  #>   <chr>         <chr>                         <lgl> <lgl>   <glue> <chr>   <lgl> #> 1 pool_sqlite   A pooled connection to an in… TRUE  FALSE   RSQLi… NA      TRUE  #> 2 simple_sqlite A simple connection to an in… TRUE  TRUE    RSQLi… NA      FALSE #> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​conn_str

title: Managing Connections
text: Connections may accessed name, live_connection()
code: myconn <- live_connection("simple_sqlite") myconn #> <SQLiteConnection> #>   Path:  #>   Extensions: TRUE

title: Managing Connections
text: first connection file highest precedence (.e. last one read) becomes default default. connection used whenever queries files SQL executed (runqueries() runfiles()) without explicitly stating connection use. can check default connection connection_info() get_default_conn_name() change set_default_conn_name().
code: get_default_conn_name() #> [1] "simple_sqlite"  set_default_conn_name("pool_sqlite")  get_default_conn_name() #> [1] "pool_sqlite"  get_default_conn_name() |>   live_connection() #> <Pool> #>   Public: #>     clone: function (deep = FALSE)  #>     close: function ()  #>     counters: environment #>     fetch: function ()  #>     idleTimeout: 60 #>     initialize: function (factory, minSize, maxSize, idleTimeout, validationInterval,  #>     maxSize: Inf #>     minSize: 1 #>     release: function (object)  #>     state: environment #>     valid: TRUE #>     validationInterval: 600 #>   Private: #>     cancelScheduledTask: function (object, task)  #>     changeObjectStatus: function (object, to)  #>     checkValid: function (object)  #>     checkValidTemplate: function (object, errorFun)  #>     createObject: function ()  #>     destroyObject: function (object)  #>     factory: function ()  #>     freeObjects: environment #>     idCounter: 2 #>     validate: function (object)

title: Managing Connections
text: can check whether connections live two ways: connection_info() provides ‘live’ field interactive use functions is_connected() not_connected() intended programmatic use. close connections remove internal cache, use disconnect(). Individual connections may closed DBI::dbDisconnect(). connect() closes open connections reading config files.
code: conn_name <- "simple_sqlite"  is_connected(conn_name) #> [1] TRUE connection_info(conn_name)$live #> [1] TRUE  myconn <- live_connection(conn_name) DBI::dbDisconnect(myconn)  connection_info() #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   name          description                   live  default driver conn_…¹ pool  #>   <chr>         <chr>                         <lgl> <lgl>   <glue> <chr>   <lgl> #> 1 pool_sqlite   A pooled connection to an in… TRUE  TRUE    RSQLi… NA      TRUE  #> 2 simple_sqlite A simple connection to an in… FALSE FALSE   RSQLi… NA      FALSE #> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​conn_str  if(not_connected(conn_name)){   message(glue::glue("{conn_name} is not available, reconnecting..."))   connect("resources/sqlhelper_db_conf.yml", exclusive = TRUE) } #> simple_sqlite is not available, reconnecting...  connection_info() #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   name          description                   live  default driver conn_…¹ pool  #>   <chr>         <chr>                         <lgl> <lgl>   <glue> <chr>   <lgl> #> 1 pool_sqlite   A pooled connection to an in… TRUE  FALSE   RSQLi… NA      TRUE  #> 2 simple_sqlite A simple connection to an in… TRUE  TRUE    RSQLi… NA      FALSE #> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​conn_str  disconnect()  connection_info() #> NULL

title: Authors and Citation
text: Matthew Roberts. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Roberts M (2023). sqlhelper: Easier SQL integration. R package version 0.1.1, https://majr-red.github.io/sqlhelper/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sqlhelper: Easier SQL integration},   author = {Matthew Roberts},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://majr-red.github.io/sqlhelper/}, }

title: Easier SQL integration
text: Easier SQL integration R

title: Easier SQL integration
text: sqlhelper three things: manages connections RDBMSs. Multiple DBI connections configured YAML stored background easy access name. provides functions preparing executing sql queries files sql queries. simply provide query filename (lists queries filenames). provides helper functions facilitate interactive use defensive programming, e.g. check connection live executing sql. , course, many excellent ways execute code database R, often involving SQL (e.g. dbplyr); sqlhelper times want use SQL - perhaps inherited legacy SQL, need specific functionality offered RDBMS, simply prefer write SQL.

title: Easier SQL integration
text: Install github:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("majr-red/sqlhelper")

title: Easier SQL integration
text: data wrangling, probably want write SQL queries files use runfiles(): exploratory work might just want run short queries; case runqueries() :
code: # load sqlhelper library(sqlhelper)  # If your admin has kindly provided a site-wide config, or you have set up # your own, you can connect to your all your databases with: connect()  # Otherwise, you'll need to provide a config file  # (see 'Getting Started' for what to put in it) # connect("path/to/db_config_file.yml")  # write some queries files_to_run <- list("path/to/create_temporary_dataset.sql",                      "path/containing/final_merge.sql",                      "folder/enclosing/extract_subsets.sql")  # Run the queries and save the results results <- runfiles(files_to_run)  # Inspect the results. By default, runfiles() returns a list of the results of  # each query in the files you provided. Results of a specific query can be accessed by the # the name of the query. See 'Getting Started' for more on named queries.  head(results$my_extracted_subset) library(sqlhelper) connect()  # write some queries my_queries <- list(   usedb="use COVID19",    showtabs="select * from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES" )  # Run the queries and save the results results <- runqueries(my_queries)  # Inspect the results. runqueries() returns a list with one element per query. # You can access them using the names of the queries: head(results$showtabs)

what: Examples of yaml configurations for databases — config_examples
title: Examples of yaml configurations for databases — config_examples
text: Provides example configurations several databases range options

title: Examples of yaml configurations for databases — config_examples
code: config_examples(filename = NA)

title: Examples of yaml configurations for databases — config_examples
text: filename string. supplied, examples written file name.

title: Examples of yaml configurations for databases — config_examples
text: yaml string database configuration examples, invisibly.

title: Examples of yaml configurations for databases — config_examples
text: Irrespective whether filename supplied, yaml configuration examples returned invisibly single string printed session interactive.

title: Examples of yaml configurations for databases — config_examples
code: config_examples()  # to write the examples to a file called 'examples.yml' if (FALSE)  config_examples("examples.yml")

title: (Re-)Establish connections to databases — connect
text: Closes open connections, reads config files directed config_filename exclusive, creates new connections descriptions files.

title: (Re-)Establish connections to databases — connect
code: connect(config_filename = NA, exclusive = FALSE)

title: (Re-)Establish connections to databases — connect
text: config_filename String. full name path configuration file, "site", "user", "example", NA (default). NA exclusive = TRUE. exclusive Logical. TRUE, file named config_filename treated config file. Site user level files read. parameter ignored config_filename missing.

title: (Re-)Establish connections to databases — connect
text: NULL, invisibly

title: (Re-)Establish connections to databases — connect
text: exclusive=FALSE (default), configuration files sought directory returned rappdirs::site_config_dir(), directory returned rappdirs::user_config_dir(), finally file named config_filename (NA). elements files conflict, later files overwrite elements earlier files. exclusive=TRUE, 1 file read, indicated config_filename parameter. config_filename = "site", config file called sqlhelper_db_conf.yml sought directory returned rappdirs::site_config_dir() config_filename = "user", config file called sqlhelper_db_conf.yml sought directory returned rappdirs::user_config_dir() config_filename NULL ("site" "user"), assumed name file. vignette("connections") explains write config file access created connections.

title: (Re-)Establish connections to databases — connect
code: if (FALSE) { # Search for config files in rappdirs::site_config_dir(), # rappdirs::user_config_dir(), and read `my_connections.yml` in the current # working directory connect("my_connections.yml")  # Read only `my_connections.yml` in the current working directory connect("my_connections.yml", exclusive=TRUE) }

title: Browse available connections — connection_info
text: Provides information created connections.

title: Browse available connections — connection_info
code: connection_info(name_str = ".*")

title: Browse available connections — connection_info
text: name_str regular expression used identify connection names include. default ('.*') returns .

title: Browse available connections — connection_info
text: Null, tibble 1 row per connection following fields: name identifier (character) description description connection, found conf file (character) live connection valid live? (logical) driver name driver function (character) conn_str string used parameterize connection (character) pool pool connection? (logical) connection names matched name_str, tibble empty. connections configured, NULL returned.

what: Close all connections and remove them from the connections cache — disconnect
title: Close all connections and remove them from the connections cache — disconnect
text: Close connections remove connections cache

title: Close all connections and remove them from the connections cache — disconnect
code: disconnect()

what: Test whether a database is connected — is_connected
title: Test whether a database is connected — is_connected
text: Test whether database connected

title: Test whether a database is connected — is_connected
code: is_connected(conn_name)  not_connected(conn_name)

title: Test whether a database is connected — is_connected
text: conn_name Character. name connection (run connection_info() options)

title: Test whether a database is connected — is_connected
text: Logical, NULL conn_name identify exactly 1 connection

title: Test whether a database is connected — is_connected
text: not_connected provided readability, identical !is_connected().

title: prepare to queries and meta data for running — prepare_sql
code: prepare_sql(   sql,   quotesql = "yes",   values = parent.frame(),   execmethod = "get",   geometry = NA,   default_conn = NA )

title: prepare to queries and meta data for running — prepare_sql
text: sql optionally-named list character vector containing sql commands, tibble returned read_sql_file() quotesql "yes" "" - interpolated characters quoted default? execmethod One "get", "send" "spatial" - method used execute query? "get" means DBI::dbGetQuery(); "send" means DBI::dbSendQuery(); "spatial" means sf::st_read(). geometry execmethod "spatial", column contains geometry? (ignored execmethod spatial) interpolate SQL parameterized R? Defaults value parent.frame(). Pass object environment (e.g. "" FALSE) interpolation skipped, another environment containing values interpolate avoid using .GlobalEnv. conn Either name sqlhelper connection, database connection returned DBI::dbConnect(), NA

title: Read a sql file and return it's contents as a tibble — read_sql
text: file_name Full name path file read

title: Read a sql file and return it's contents as a tibble — read_sql
text: tibble containing 1 row per query following fields: qname character. name query quotesql "yes" "". parameterized character values quoted query? Defaults "yes". interpolate "yes" "". query parameterized values R? Defaults "yes". execmethod method execute query. One "get" (DBI::dbGetQuery()), "execute" (DBI::dbExecute()), "sendq" (DBI::dbSendQuery()), "sends" (DBI::dbSendStatement()) "spatial" (sf:st_read()) geometry character. execmethod "spatial", geometry column? conn name database connection use query sql unparameterized sql query executed filename value file_name

what: Execute a list of .sql files — runfiles

text: Accepts character vector SQL file names runs one either hive postgresql.

title: Execute a list of .sql files — runfiles
code: runfiles(   filenames,   quotesql = TRUE,   values = parent.frame(),   execmethod = "get",   geometry = NA,   default_conn = live_connection(get_default_conn_name()),   include_params = FALSE )

title: Execute a list of .sql files — runfiles
text: filenames character vector containing sql file names, including paths working directory db Defaults 'cds' option DAP Although can specify db parameter, preferred way include -- db=<dbname> comment sql file. See details. interpolate defaults value parent.frame(). May set FALSE interpolation avoided, another environment control source used. can useful sqlhelper used run SQL within another package, want interfere .GlobalEnv. See details.

title: Execute a list of .sql files — runfiles
text: Depending input, runfiles returns one : list lists (multiple files) outer list contains one list file filenames. inner list named file basename contains results query file. list (single file containing several queries) element result query. R object (files containing single query). result query, e.g. dataframe SELECT statement, single element character vector CREATE TABLE statement. runfiles() try flatten list intelligently name lots containers contain one element inspect results. may mean get dataframe expecting list, e.g. file contains one query.

title: Execute a list of .sql files — runfiles
text: queries sent database execution, runfiles interprets comments parameterizes queries. Comment interpretation: sqlhelper can extract parameters two kinds SQL comments. must occur line . -- db=cds db parameter legacy previous versions package, multiple databases available. use DAP, 'cds' accepted value. Case insensitive. Use first query file. quote parameter! example, use -- db=cds, -- db="cds". -- qname=<a_name_for_this_query> qname parameter assigns name query, can used access result query. quote parameter! example, query called create_tab, use -- qname=create_tab, -- qname="create_tab". Query parameterization: Queries may parameterized values R. fact may run arbitrary R code parameterize queries. Parameters enclosed braces ({...}). defined parameter max_rows R: max_rows <- 10 might use SQLServer code part TOP clause get 10 rows table: SELECT TOP {max_rows} * mytable query submitted server, parameterized : SELECT TOP 10 * mytable default, parameters searched package global environment, defined parameters globally, found. might always want though. example, calling runfiles run parameterized SQL within package, interfere user's global environment. case want pass environment containing required parameters. case use interpolate argument: want avoid parameterization R altogether, set interpolate parameter FALSE.
code: >param_env <- new.env()   >param_env$max_rows <- 10   >runfiles("my_queries.sql", interpolate=param_env)

text: sql optionally-named list character vector containing sql commands, tibble returned read_sql() quotesql "yes" "" - interpolated characters quoted default? execmethod One "get", "execute", "sendq", "sends" "spatial" - method used execute query? "get" means DBI::dbGetQuery(); "execute" means DBI::dbExecute(); "sendq" means DBI::dbSendQuery; "sends" means DBI::dbSendStatement(); "spatial" means sf::st_read(). geometry execmethod "spatial", geometry column used (ignored execmethod spatial) include_params parameters included output? interpolate SQL parameterized R? Defaults value parent.frame(). Pass object environment (e.g. "" FALSE) interpolation skipped, another environment containing values interpolate avoid using .GlobalEnv. conn Either name sqlhelper connection, database connection returned DBI::dbConnect(), NA

title: Execute a sequence of SQL queries — runqueries
text: include_params FALSE, named list containing results query; names sql parameter. include_params TRUE, tibble containing query executed, parameters, result query.
